intro: Rouliniella corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silky hair, while its stems are upright and branching. The flowers range in color from blue to purple and are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
